Posts.Content: Hi Bev, that sounds same as me. 6 treatments at three week intervals. Three of FEC which is a combination treatment and then three of Docetaxil (taxotere) I'm given three tablets before we start followed by a Steroid drip and two bags of fluids. I'm guessing That my tablet equivalent to yours is Dexamethasone. I get one Aprepitant and two Dexamethasone. The Aprepitant was added to combat nausea and has been very effective and dex I believe is the steroid that also stops you feeling sick as well. Sounds like they may do similar jobs. I take them on the day of treatment and for three days after along with a couple of others that have been added in after round 1 review. Maybe Dreamthief can encourage my laziness to read in to it at this time of the night and confirm if the drugs do similar jobs. :-) xx
Posts.Title: Have i made the wrong decision

Posts.Content: Hi Bev, I'm on FEC and Docetaxel so can't comment on dexrazoxane. All I can say is it's never too late to change your mind but speak to your oncologist again until you are completely satisfied with their reasons for choosing this as the right course of treatment for you. They are the experts and will have chosen what's best. although 4 months seems a long time my personal experience, having completed the FEC part of my treatment yesterday, is that it has flown in. I'm not looking forward to the next one as it's more aggressive but it's 9 weeks of my life. It might be a rough 9 but when it's done it's done. I know this doesn't give you the specific answers you need but I'm sure you won't be alone on this treatment plan and others will share their experiences soon. Good luck for the coming months xxx
Posts.Title: Have i made the wrong decision

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief. That article on Dex is really informative. epirubicin is one of the drugs I've just finished. My side effects have been relatively minor but it's all interesting stuff.
Posts.Title: Have i made the wrong decision

Posts.Content: Ps FEC has been kind to me. I've been tired but nothing much to complain about at all.
Posts.Title: Have i made the wrong decision

Posts.Content: Pepys, so sorry you are having such a tough time too. My heart goes out to you x Fingers n toes are crossed that the antibiotics start to work and the injections make the nausea manageable xxx
Posts.Title: chemotherapy - I'm struggling

Posts.Content: Hi Katherine x I'm just arising from my post chemo fog :-) hit me last session on day 4 as well. I have slept for most of the last three days. I just wanted to say I think you are amazing to have dealt with everything that's been thrown at you!! Each event on it's own is major let alone having triple trauma. Be kind to yourself and let your friends and family pamper you at every opportunity. Pepys, we shall not flag or fail :-). did round 2 go ahead ?
Posts.Title: chemotherapy - I'm struggling

Posts.Content: Hi Katherine, there's a certain irony in the appointment date isn't there!! I wonder if the appointment fairy is at work? My first appointment with my oncologist was 22nd July.....my birthday. She apologised, but when I said that it's not often we get a birthday present that can ultimately save our lives she agreed that it wasn't that bad after all. I have four more chemo sessions ahead. I like to think that in two more weeks I am half way there :-). I'm to have radiation after chemo but not sure how many. 15 seems to be the norm. I had my surgery RBM on 7th July and next year hope to have my reconstruction. I'm hoping to have the DIEP flap ...I was born with this tummy for a reason ;-) I feel very lucky that my treatment is going so much easier than most. Apart from being easily tired and little appetite (lost a stone in 7 weeks!!! I've been trying to do that for years!!! ) I have nothing at all to complain about. We're not ill, we are just having some minor cell adjustment ;-) hope everything goes well for you on the 16th in every respect. Take Care xxxx Sonia
Posts.Title: chemotherapy - I'm struggling

Posts.Content: Losing my hair, my eyebrows and eyelashes was my biggest worry! How crazy is that. However when the first few strands started to fall I bit the bullet got the clippers on the go and gave myself a baldy :-) I hadn't picked up my wig at that point but had loads of scarves from Annabandana. An absolute must for chemo patients. It's so much cheaper than most. I LOVE my scarves. Picked up my wig on Tuesday and it is really really nice, Trendco, Codi in moccachino :-) but it's not been on outside yet until I'm certain it stays put on a windy day in the garden!! If you have access to Maggie Centre (Scotland) or you have similar where you are enquire about 'looking good,feeling better' sessions. It's all about skincare and makeup application to help make the best of what you have. It is amazing, Hope your chemo goes well, I'm two down four to go xx
Posts.Title: hair starting to go :-(

Posts.Content: Never did like paying my taxes so I think I'll keep my fingers crossed that Docetaxil is as kind to me a FEC was and just deal with it as it happens. I suppose too much knowledge can sometimes be a bad thing so I'll face this round the same way as the last one. What will be will be and deal with it if and when you have to. Another motto, Don't go looking for trouble" . Compared to most I seem to be pretty fortunate so far. I think it's helped by having great friends and what has now turned into the regular 'lunch club' at Sonia's house!! I'm off work so my kitchen has replaced the staff lounge!! My justification is I haven't had a day sick in 20 years and it's a tough job that needs stamina and concentration neither of which I have in abundance at the minute. I might create havoc so so I decided to have me me me time :-) I'm so self indulgent ;-)
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, had my last FEC yesterday hence the post chemo 5am internal alarm. Half way now and a few problems creeping in. Veins are proving to be stubborn accepting the cannula. However only two attempts after an hour in a heat blanket did it this time. Unfortunately I have chemical phlebitis but exercising has helped a lot. I thought I could avoid antibiotics but my neutrophils have dropped to just above the level where chemo would be delayed so it's antibiotics after all. So that's the story so far....what's the low down on Docetaxil, who did their own steroid injections? did you feel like a train ran you over ? Did your nails fall off ? I hated that scene in The Fly!! I'm hoping my care team have painted the absolute worst case scenario!! So would love to hear your experiences good n bad. Oh and have you gained weight? I lost a stone in three weeks after first FEC but since anti emetics have been adjusted 7 of those pesky pounds have come back to find me!! Damn it !! Hope this is a good day for you all and if not be kind to yourself xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, thanks for the new posts. My first session of Docetaxil is now two weeks away. Like you say Crystal Kitty, we can't stop now!! Just keep going everyone until we're all out of the tunnel xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: Oh thanks for the info guys. I can't say I'm relishing the thought of what might be ahead but hey ho it's all part of life's big adventure. One more experience to notch up !! Jujuxx I giggled at your date with the ensuite but poor you. I hope it gets better for you xx Jmwatson I share your views, they'll tell us the worst case scenario and hope that you don't face it. I'm already on antibiotics as neutrophils are lower than they would like. I've also got chemical phlebitis so that doesn't make me confident about tax. But I also share your views of looking on the bright side :-) but you are having it rough too. :-( My focus is it's only going to last 9 weeks and it's done. If I get the brown sticky stuff thrown at me I will have a moan on here and I know you will all get me through it. Thanks again ladies for sharing. It certainly makes FEC sound like a chemo pussycat. Talking of which my cat is nibbling my elbow for attention :-) iPad jealousy !! And the referendum results are coming in!! History in the making!! And I have the benefit of steroids to keep me awake for it :-)
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: There's a popular saying in my neck of the woods Ladies "if you don't laugh you greet". Laughter has got me to this stage and I hope I have the inner strength to get through the next three sessions. It sounds like an absolute nightmare but thanks to you guys I have the reassurance that the train does come off eventually!! Typical trains eh! Never stick to a timetable. I am so shallow 😳 I have one hope for my nails. I have a wonky thumbnail on each hand due to damaged nail beds so maybe if they fall off they'll come back better 😜 Emma, Lindy, JM and Juju thanks for staring and good luck with your next stage of treatment xxx and Dreamthief thank you too, forewarned is forearmed!! X
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: Hi Mrs Shep, I hope today is a better day for you xx It would not be normal for any of us to be 'up beat' with smiley faces every day. The front we are all surely putting up a lot of the time has to slip and let our emotions breathe!! Go for it girl, if you need a cry, cry. Or as we say where I am, " if you need a guid greet have one". Re your wig, mine is beautiful but I know what you mean. It doesn't look like me despite the fact that the few close friends who have seen it (brutally honest friends) have said it looks great. My issue is that I haven't got faith that the band holding it on will not wriggle up my head and it'll spring off on the high street in the wind leaving me chasing it!! I have a vision that it looks like a Yorkshire Terrier making a break for freedom!! So, until I have faith that it will stay put I am extremely comfortable in my scarves and bandanas. Did you let your regular hairdresser see your wig? If not might be an idea to ask if he/she could have a look to fine tune the look xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling Down

Posts.Content: What a moment to remember X Well done you. Full clearance must've hurt. I had snb and mastectomy and thought the snb was the worst bit. I agree though. Not anything as bad as I thought it would be. I'll be on Letrozole too when I'm done. A pill a day is no hardship is it :-) Congrats on beating cancers butt xx
Posts.Title: I did it!! 😜

Posts.Content: I have grinned from ear to ear since yesterday when I had my last chemo.  I start radiotherapy soon and my last treatment is on 30th Decmber.  I'm all done in 2014 Right now I'm searching for a spring holiday somewhere far away and beautiful to recharge and prepare myself for round 2 ... New boobie !!  And the other reason for smiling.....with new boobie comes flat tummy yeehaaa never had one of them before either !!
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, I'm having 3 Fec then 3 tax. I was told no for acrylics but that's because nail technician might damage the skin when filing to do infills and increase the risk of infection. So I guess as long as there's no major filing going on your fine.
Posts.Title: Gel nails - chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi All, my chemo nurse asked if I was using any homeopathic meds and when I said no she replied 'right answer'. She advised against anything other than drugs you are told are acceptable while undergoing chemo.
Posts.Title: Help need some advice re: L iver Function test results

Posts.Content: So funny about the Knickers. I actually wanted to print on mine....I borrowed these from Bridget. The worst thing (if you gave read the thread about having a crush on your consultant) that gorgeous Irishman probably clapped eyes on them😱oh the indignity of it all !!
Posts.Title: Pre-op advice

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy x good luck, take all of the aforementioned. Dry shampoo, wipes, fan for night times. Hospitals are so hot!! Cotton pj's that button up the front. I took silky numbers and was a walking bundle of static electricity. The Pj trousers stuck to the surgical stockings. Not a good look !! iPad, book or kindle, remember the headphones for the iPad and mist if all your mobile phone. Just being able to text my friends passed the time for me. For afterwards soft bras. Button up shirts or tops. Look at Silima or Nicola Jane for bras. Debenhams, M&S and Asda also do ranges online. Underarm cushion was my saviour. Tendercrush does a nice cuddly one. And when you get home make sure you do the exercises to get your mobility back. It's natural to be scared. I was petrified in the lead up. For me the fear of the unknown and not knowing how I would handle the aftermath was much worse than reality xxx
Posts.Title: Pre-op advice

Posts.Content: Hi Helen. I have the same issue but I'm putting it down to being out in the garden instead of chained to a desk and having doors and windows open and going on long country walks. Also, My cats are treated every month but I have more contact with them now. If you have pets anything they pick up might have nipped you. The bugs don't die on the animals immediately even when they are treated with Frontline or similar. I'm using a bite and sting cream....Boots own with hydrocortisone and it's helping with the itch and stopping me from scratching so it's reducing the chance of breaking the skin and getting an infection. Hope you find the cause...and the cure xx
Posts.Title: BUG BITES

Posts.Content: Hi Sammy, I have just finished my final chemo about an hour ago. I had mastectomy in July, no recon yet. I had 3 FEC and 3 T. I think I had every side effect you could imagine with T. Muscle pain, cramps, stomach pain, nausea, heartburn. A rash, hot flushes, the skin peeled off my feet and I got blisters and sores on my hands and I can't stay awake. But you know what it's such a short time compared to the rest of your life. Cry when you feel like it...I did more than once. But when it's really bad tell yourself tomorrow will be better. I ended up with loads of drugs for the second cycle to counteract the side effects. I practically rattled and will do again for the next three weeks. They are great. They gave me Gabapentin for the pain. It's a drug used for epilepsy but also controls nerve pain. I was pretty spaced most of the time but it did give me relief. Ps I was sick to death of being told to stay positive. Look forward all the time but if you feel crap don't give youself a guilt trip about not being smiley smiley....you're allowed. Plan all the treats and adventures you'll have when you've kicked cancer in the butt. Xx
Posts.Title: when does it end?

Posts.Content: Hi Mishtoon.X I had first chemo on 6th too. My hair started falling out last Wednesday. I wanted to be in control so shaved it off the next night with the help of my fave niece. It was liberating !! I beat chemo off the blocks :-) Have a look at Annabandana. The chiffon scarves with skull cap inside are amazing and not expensive. Look at wigs by TrendCo. Not cheap but I was so lucky to find a hairdresser who uses them and supplies via NHS. I'll be wearing Codi on Tuesday. I love my scarves too though. It's all part of the journey to being whole again xx Good luck with next session. I'm in on Wednesday, you too ?
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz, that's fantastic !! Happy Friday everyone :-) it's great to start the day with good news xx Cute pic Dreamthief :-)
Posts.Title: Great News

Posts.Content: Irish anaesthetist did it for me :-) 40ish with ice blue eyes, prematurely silver hair, gorgeous smile, then he put me to sleep !!!!! He did come and visit me twice after the op tho :-). Ooooft xx
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi Katie, I wish you were feeling better but at the same time it's so good to know this is 'normal' !! I had session 3 of FEC 10 days ago. I normally get a burst of energy for 3 days and then crash for three, then pick up again. This time it's been crash and burn all the way. Been up since 3am on the loo....sorry to share !! Tomorrow is another day !! hang on in 😁 she says with gritted teeth !!! Good luck for 30th, hope your bloods are okay and there's no delays xx
Posts.Title: I'm knackered.......

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry to reply with a question rather than an answer for you x. I'm thinking of DIEP as well and will probably have to go to Glasgow or St Johns. How long is it since you had your BM? I've still got a few months of chemo and rads ahead but wondered how soon after it's all done can recon take place ? Hope you get some positive info and great results xx
Posts.Title: Mr McKay, Glasgow Royal. anyone seen him ?

Posts.Content: Hi Emma xx I thought it would take much longer. Good to hear Mr McKay is highly thought of and although I can imagine you were itching to get home too much caution is better than too little. Hope you are well now xx
Posts.Title: Mr McKay, Glasgow Royal. anyone seen him ?

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy x I'm 6 weeks post surgery and feeling great after right breast mastectomy and removal of 4 lymph nodes. My drains were out on day 2 but while they were in I carried them around in a cotton shoulder bag. I found the biggest discomfort was from the back of my armpit and down the inside of my arm. It was more of an unpleasant sensation rather than pain. If you sleep on your side hug a pillow and drape your arm over it. I also found a great cushion that fits in to your underarm that really helps when in bed or just relaxing. Have a look at www.tendercrush.co.uk. Make sure to do any physio recommended but don't overdo it. Good Luck for tomorrow x one step closer to being healthy again x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy -1day to go

Posts.Content: Hi, Mine is/was lobular invasive, er+ her2-. Stage 4 grade 2. My tumour was 5.5 cm and one of 4 nodes removed was positive. I'm having six sessions FEC-t then rads then five years on Letrozole and I see it as the belt and braces option. Chuck it all at me if it reduces the chances of recurrence. I've just had my second chemo. I felt extremely nautious after the first session but was never actually sick. Lucky Compared to others. How I had been was taken into account before session 2 and my anti emetics were increased and two more introduced. In all honesty I feel just fine. The drugs are great and it doesn't have to be a horror story. The unknown is sometimes much more frightening than reality. Go with the advice of your consultant and ask what he would do if it was his family or him. Hope it all goes well for you x
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi CC, I am entering this discussion very far down the line. Each if us is different and we will choose our own path. I am amazed that you have been willing to endure two years of uncertainty, hospital visits, time spent in waiting rooms when by now you could either be in remission with conventional treatment or at worst having the cancer controlled. Which seems to be where you are now. I was 57 when diagnosed less than 4 months ago. Probably around the same age as you when you were. My breasts and my hair were my two best features. They had stood the test of time :-) but they are replaceable, repairable and ultimately I would rather be rid if the beast that invaded my body in the quickest and most effective way (for me). The NHS is an often maligned institution but I can only be thankful that it is there for all if us. Without experimental treatment no advances would be made but in your shoes I would follow the conventional path so I could get on to my new one without delay. I sincerely hope your choices are the right ones for you and will keep up with your posts with interest. Xx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: It stops us getting bored eh Katie ;-) xx Hope they get you sorted out and you're feeling better once the shock of the vampire attack wears off. It's good info to have and thanks for posting. I've had lumps appear in various places on my scalp for the last week. So not only do I have a Tefal Man forehead I'm a budding Egghead !! Take Care xx
Posts.Title: Lumps and dull aches - which was more important????

Posts.Content: Oh it must have been the week for blubbering xx I've been the same over the stupidest things. I know how much you wanted the pretty bras so I don't think it's silly at all having a cry xx Now as for me.... In my new found domesticity I decided to bake for MacMillan coffee morning at work. Banana Loaf ... How not to make one.. 1) Measure dry ingredients, 2)accidentally flick ipad to new recipe using chemo brain 3) measure wet ingredients 4) combine two entirely different recipes and bake. Outcome .....tears and a banana steam pudding!!! We all have our off days xx don't beat yourself up about it. How long until Paris ?
Posts.Title: I had my first cry today

Posts.Content: Glad I made you smile :--)  So did I once I got over the devastation :-) lol it is so ridiculous what can upset you when you are feeling low.   At least the Lemon Drizzle and the Cherry Scones were a success.  They raised £300 in my office so it was all worth it.  Maybe I will give up the day job .... NOT!!   I'll keep my fingers crossed for you getting your fitting in time for Paris .... buy the ones you want in the hope that your Silcon Sam is ready just to pop in.  That's what I did.  I wore my fave bra to the boob measuring session and walked out with a matching pair xx
Posts.Title: I had my first cry today

Posts.Content: Morning Wendy x As far as I can see there's nothing better than bit if salt in the chicken dinner. I'm 7 weeks post surgery right side and yes we put our brave faces on. If it's any help at all I cried for Britain before I got my results. The fear of the unknown was far more difficult for me to deal with than fact. Once I got my results I found it easier to cope and focus on the road ahead which is now clearly mapped. I've had 2 sessions if chemo with four to go so neatly half way there. It's radiation next and then reconstruction. In my own mind I'm more reassured by the fact that I'm having chemo because I see it as the belt and braces approach. If any of the nasty little so n so's have wandered unseen their days are numbered!! Good Luck for Thursday and don't be scared to let your tears out when they need to xx better out than in x. Hubby sounds fab so let him hold you tight and give you the hug you need x
Posts.Title: Bad Sunday ! Hoping for better Monday!

Posts.Content: Sounds like today is a better day Wendy xx Open top bus with no rain and lots of scenic stops sounds good to me :-) xx
Posts.Title: Bad Sunday ! Hoping for better Monday!

Posts.Content: Hi Gillie, I'm on my first chemo session too and was a bit the same. Have you got a thermometer? If not ask your chemo dept for one or pick up a digital one in the chemist. I took my temp about 5 times a day in the first few days of paranoia!! It helped me put things in perspective and I keep it handy now and only use it if I don't feel 100% I also had really sore gums and mouth. I'm using a mouth wash called Gengigel. It's not cheap but very effective. Hope you feel better soon xx
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: Deep Joy! I used to carry a handy pack of tissues in my bag. I've upgraded to a box of man size for the runny nose and constantly watering eyes! I have just been congratulating myself on keeping the upper eyelashes and brows and most of my bottom lashes but I guess I'll need to wait and see what happens in the Tax Lottery 😁
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: Can defo see myself in the turban and just discreetly whip Juan Sheet off in emergencies 😊
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn, you say your on your 4th treatment. What are you on. I've had three FEC and shaved my hair off on day 17. I think I would still have had quite a lot as it was exceptionally thick but decided to lob it off incase it did get bad. Yesterday was last of the FEC and I move on to Docetaxel next. I've been told that my hair will start to grow back in 6-8 weeks as Hairloss is not a side effect of Docetaxel (taxotere).
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: One of my workmates hair grew back in in tiny little lamb curls. it was absolutely beautiful and straightened out as it regrew. Xx
Posts.Title: Hair Re-growth

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with LIC on 20th May and have had biopsy taken from 3 sites since then.  All three came back positive.    I've been on Letrozole since 27 th May and the difference in how my breast feels in the last few days is incredible. It almost feels like the other one again.  I know this is probably because bruising and swelling has gone down but I'm having a mastectomy and sentinel node removal on 7th July and clutching at straws.   Can it be shrinking?  Will surgeon just go ahead and remove my whole breast anyway? Can I ask for more tests? Am I clutching at straws? I always thought I would say 'yep,  just take it off' but when push comes to shove it's not that easy.
Posts.Title: Pre surgery.

Posts.Content: I'm with Mistymoley on this one. Your baseline temp may be low so don't take any chances. Play safe and make that call in the morning xx
Posts.Title: Any one else had this side effect

Posts.Content: Hey Katie123, how are you?
Posts.Title: Any one else had this side effect

Posts.Content: Hi Flosse123 x I can't imagine how you're feeling but it's good that you have an option to have more treatment. It's bound to be a blow that you need more chemo but you've got through it before. Be strong and do it again xx beat it xx
Posts.Title: Undergoing chemo twice!

Posts.Content: Thanks Tej0362. That makes perfect sense. I had steroids with chemo. I also switched brain on having forgotten my own golden rule. What else has changed. I shaved my hair couple of weeks ago but shampoo and condition my scalp daily. I started using a different shampoo so that's another possible cause. Will go back to the old one and monitor my glow :-) will also hive bcn a ring on Monday if there's no change. Thanks for the reply, Take Care xx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question

Posts.Content: Thank Vicki, I've always been a bit pasty without my warpaint so it's quite a noticeable change :-) good to know I'm not alone in so many ways. X hope you are doing well too ? How many have you to go? Xx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question

Posts.Content: Thanks :-) You too xx Hope the recon goes well in the New Year xx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question

Posts.Content: Hi all, I had my second FEC-T on Wednesday and feeling so much better than last time thanks to a new approach on the anti sickness front. This time around though I look like I've been on a sunbed for way too long !! Face, neck, chest are displaying a definitely overdone sun kissed glow!! My temp us fine, having to drink water by the litre to keep headaches down but apart from that nothing to moan about xx Free suntan without exposure ?
Posts.Title: Another side effect question

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry about the late reply, Prochloperazine 3mg for five days 1 breakfast 1 tea. Dissolves between gum and lip. Dexamethasone 2mg x 2 tabs breakfast and lunch, Granisetron 1mg x1 breakfast and tea, Aprepitant 125mg on day of chemo and 80mg for two mornings after chemo. This combo has worked amazingly well for me. No nausea and very minor heartburn. Xx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question
